title: December 7
description:
John, a.k.a Dean's dad, a.k.a Papa John and his wife Linda came to visit. Since it had been 2 years since their last visit, you'd think we'd have taken a commemorative photo but you would be thinking wrong. Somehow, we forgot. Are we losing our touch?

Anyway, it was very nice to see them. The kids were delighted make their re-acquaintance (they didn't really remember them from last time). We went on a family trip to the Walt Disney Family Museum in the Presidio in San Francisco.

children.title: Kids room
children.description: Felix and Milo's room got a makeover this week. Little-boy toys have been boxed. Furniture has been reshuffled. Milo's toddler bed has made way for a Big Kid bed.

children.title: Small Bed
children.description:
This is the bed Milo slept in until Tuesday. He couldn't stretch without touching both the headboard and the footboard.

We had been procrastinating because we were waiting for him to be over bedwetting (small sheets are easier to change). Now he's over it and very proud to move to the Big Bed.

children.title: Big Bed
children.description:
Milo and Lucie took a trip to IKEA to select his new bed. That evening, we happened to have friends over for supper so we didn't get around to assemble the bed before bedtime. Milo was disappointed. He refused to sleep in his little bed but agreed to sleep on his new mattress on the floor.

The Bed Fairies must have come during the night, because in the morning when he woke up, he was in his new bed!!! And there was sparkly dust on the windowsill. It's a mystery.

children.title: I Can Read!
children.description: Milo decided it was time to start reading this weekend. He's going through our beginner books like a hot knife through butter.

children.title: Felix's Corner
children.description:
Felix has the same bed but it's changed location.

His request for the new room arrangement was for a small table and shelf next to his bed to call his own. Wish granted.

children.title: Bottle Caps
children.description:
The rug moved closer to the window. Also, the selection of toys in the room has changed, to make space for an exclusively-LEGO room next to the guest room. Henceforth it shall be called the Legosphere.

Felix's bottle cap collection is growing... nearly 600 at the latest count!

children.title: Linda
children.description: Linda reads a bedtime book to the boys.

children.title: Grappling Hooks
children.description: <cite>Spies on Water</cite> by Felix: grappling hooks on grappling hooks, Jet Ski backpack and flying surfboards.

children.title: Elf
children.description: Felix the Gentle Elf in line at Macy's, waiting for his picture to be taken with Santa.

children.title: Santa 1
children.description:
Felix asked for the very last and very biggest LEGO Mars Mission Space Station.

Milo asked for PEZ dispensers. He aims to start collectin'.

children.title: Santa 2
children.description: Santa said yes to LEGO and PEZ. Yeah!
